If the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf] {Unconscious} or refuses to accept your gift, or if the spell would teleport a creature (even if the creature is inside an extradimensional container), the spell fails.

Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

Heightened (5th) As 3rd level, and the object's maximum Bulk increases to 1. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz] {Cast the Spell} with 3 actions instead of 1; doing so increases the range to 1 mile and you don't need line of sight to the target, but you must be extremely familiar with the target.

Threefold Aspect.name: Threefold Aspect
Threefold Aspect.description:
This spell allows you to change between three versions of yourself of different ages: a maiden (young adult), a mother (adult), or a matriarch (elderly). Choose one when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz] {Cast the Spell} . While the spell lasts, you can change the age to any of the three or to your natural age with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. Your form always looks like you regardless of the age, and creatures who know you still recognize you and can tell your age is different.

Threefold aspect alters your physical appearance and personality to present an authentic version of yourself at various ages. This grants you a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to pass as the chosen age, and you can add your level as a proficiency bonus to these checks even if you're untrained. Furthermore, unless a creature specifically uses a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ] {Seek} action or otherwise carefully examines you, it doesn't get a chance to notice that you aren't at your true age. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AjLSHZSWQ90exdLo] {Dismiss} this spell.

Thunderburst.name: Thunderburst
Thunderburst.description:
You create a powerful blast of air and a loud peal of thunder, dealing 2d6 bludgeoning damage and 2d6 sonic damage. Each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR] {Deafened} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is Deafened for 1 hour.

Heightened (+2) Increase each type of damage by 2d6 and the area by 5 feet.

Thundering Dominance.name: Thundering Dominance
Thundering Dominance.description:
You shroud the target in a powerful predatory aura and amplify its vocalizations. It gains a +1 status bonus to Intimidation checks. Once during this spell's duration, it can take the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.6SAdjml3OZw0BZnn] {Thundering Roar} action.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.81TfqzTfIqkQA4Dy] {Spell Effect: Thundering Dominance}

Heightened (+2) The status bonus to Intimidation checks increases by 1 (to a maximum of a +4 status bonus for an 8th-rank spell), and the damage from the roar increases by 2d8.

Thunderous Strike.name: Thunderous Strike
Thunderous Strike.description:
You swing your massive weapon, creating a wave of sonic vibrations that topples creatures. Make a melee Strike with your two-handed weapon. Each creature in a 15-foot cone from you must attempt a basic Fortitude save against your spell DC or take 2 sonic damage. On a critical failure, the creature is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone} . The target of your Strike must be within the cone or the effect fails.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1.

Note: Conflux spells refresh Spellstrike.

Thunderstrike.name: Thunderstrike
Thunderstrike.description:
You call down a tendril of lightning that cracks with thunder, dealing 1d12 electricity damage and 1d4 sonic damage to the target with a basic Reflex save. A target wearing metal armor or made of metal takes a –1 circumstance bonus to its save, and if damaged by the spell is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm] {Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d12 electricity and 1d4 sonic.

Tidal Surge.name: Tidal Surge
Tidal Surge.description: You call forth a tremendous wave to move the target either in a body of water or on the ground. You move the target up to 10 feet in any direction along the ground or 20 feet through a body of water. An unwilling target can attempt a Fortitude save, and it avoids being moved if it succeeds.

Timber.name: Timber
Timber.description:
You create a small dead tree in your space that falls over on anyone in its path, then immediately decomposes. Any creature in the area takes @Damage[2d4[bludgeoning] ] damage, with a basic Reflex saving throw. A creature that critically fails its save is knocked for a loop, making it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh] {Dazzled} until the end of its next turn.

Heightened (+1) The initial damage increases by [[/r 1d4]] .

Time Beacon.name: Time Beacon
Time Beacon.description: You create a beacon in time, intending to return to it if things go wrong. You can cast time beacon on only your turn. Keep careful track of everything that happens this turn after you cast time beacon . At the end of your turn, you can choose to rewind time back to just after you cast time beacon , removing all effects of your turn since then. Curses, traps, and other harmful effects that happen during your turn might prevent you from returning to the beacon if they are powerful enough. If you suffered any harmful effects during your turn after casting time beacon , to return to your beacon, time beacon attempts a counteract check against each such effect. If it fails at any of these checks, you can't return. After returning to the time beacon , the spell ends.

Time Jump.name: Time Jump
Time Jump.description:
You leap forward a few seconds in time, appearing across the battlefield in the blink of an eye. You gain 2 actions, each of which must be used to Leap, Stand, Step, or Stride. If you have an appropriate Speed, you can add @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG] {Burrow} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy] {Climb} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p] {Fly} , or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx] {Swim} to this list. While you take these actions, time pauses. All other creatures are completely unaware of your actions, can't speak, and can't use any actions that would be triggered by your movement.

While you're taking these actions, you can't take any other actions, including any that would be triggered by the move actions. Once the actions are complete, time starts again, and to onlookers, you seem to have suddenly teleported across the distance you traveled. Leaping forward through time is disorienting, so if you use time jump again within 1 minute of using the spell, you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg] {Stupefied 4} for 1 minute.

Time Pocket.name: Time Pocket
Time Pocket.description:
You fling the target item forward in time and link it to the future of the creature holding it. The item disappears. When the spell ends, the item reappears with the creature that was holding it when you Cast the Spell. If the creature has enough hands free to hold the item, it appears in their hands. Otherwise, it falls to the ground in the creature's space.

You can Dismiss the spell, and it automatically ends if you're reduced to 0 Hit Points or cast time pocket again.
Time Pocket.target: one item of 1 Bulk or less that a willing creature is holding

Time Sense.name: Time Sense
Time Sense.description:
When you Cast the Spell, you gain a perfect sense of time. You can learn exactly what time it is, down to the second. You can instead choose to gain a perfect sense of the calendar if you have knowledge in that area-if you're trained in Nature, you can learn exactly how long it is until sunrise and how many days until the next solstice. If you're trained in Astronomy Lore, you can learn precisely when any known predictable astronomical conjunction will begin and end, and so on.

You can gain a +1 status bonus to one attack roll, Perception check, saving throw, or skill check you take on the same turn you cast time sense that requires extremely precise timing. If you choose to gain this bonus, you can't gain it again for 1 hour.

Time Skip.name: Time Skip
Time Skip.description:
You manipulate time around your ally, pushing them forward a few moments in time. The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl] {Quickened} on its next turn and can use the action only to Step, Stride, or Strike.

Heightened (+1) You can one additional willing creature other than yourself within range.

Timely Tutor.name: Timely Tutor
Timely Tutor.description:
You serve as an astral connection between your eidolon or familiar and the Akashic Record-a demiplane consisting of a comprehensive psychic library-then turn to the creature for advice. If you cast this spell on your familiar, your familiar adds your spellcasting ability modifier on checks to Recall Knowledge with the Lore skill of your choice, much like it does for Acrobatics and Stealth. Your familiar must have the speech familiar ability in order to share any information it learns with you. If you cast this spell on your eidolon, it instead becomes trained in the Lore skill.

If you lose physical contact with the target, its connection to the Akashic Record is severed and timely tutor immediately ends.

Tireless Worker.name: Tireless Worker
Tireless Worker.description: You suppress your choice of one of the following conditions that's affecting the target: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm] {Clumsy} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7] {Encumbered} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7] {Enfeebled} , or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw] {Fatigued} . If you don't remove the effect that caused the condition, the condition returns after the spell's duration expires.

Tomorrow's Dawn.name: Tomorrow's Dawn
Tomorrow's Dawn.description:
The golden light of a new dawn and the promise of life beyond death radiates from your body. You cast bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) and gain mental resistance 5. Any nindoru fiend or undead that begins its turn adjacent to you must attempt a Will save with the following results.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.SyF5kpZlZuBF4lMf] {Spell Effect: Tomorrow's Dawn}

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and immune to this spell's effects for the remainder of the spell's duration.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18] {Sickened 1} until the end of its turn.

Failure The creature is sickened 1. In addition, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3] {Slowed 1} until the end of its next turn.

Critical Failure As failure, but @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18] {Sickened 2} and the creature remains slowed 1 for the rest of the spell's duration.

Heightened (6th) You gain mental resistance 10.

Heightened (8th) You gain mental resistance 15.

Tortoise and the Hare.name: Tortoise and the Hare
Tortoise and the Hare.description:
You prove that slow and steady doesn't always win the race by turning a foe into a proverbial tortoise and yourself or an ally into a hare, siphoning some of the foe's speed and granting it to the other target. The effects depend on the foe's Fortitude save.

Critical Success The targets are unaffected.

Success The foe is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3] {Slowed 1} for 1 round, and the other target is unaffected.

Failure The foe is slowed 1 for 3 rounds and the other target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl] {Quickened} for 1 round. It can use the extra action to Step, Stride, or Strike.

Critical Failure The foe is slowed 1 for 3 minutes and the other target is quickened for 1 minute. It can use the extra action to Step, Stride, or Strike.
Tortoise and the Hare.target: 1 foe, and either yourself or 1 ally

Torturous Trauma.name: Torturous Trauma
Torturous Trauma.description:
With this spell born of Kemnebi's sadistic love of torture, you batter a creature's internal organs, leaving no external signs of the immense pain you delivered. The target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting modifier with a basic Fortitude save. If it critically fails, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw] {Fatigued} until the start of your next turn. Creatures that lack internal organs are unaffected by this spell.

Heightened (+1) The bludgeoning damage increases by 1d4.

Touch of Corruption.name: Touch of Corruption
Touch of Corruption.description:
You infuse the target with void energy. If the target is living, this deals 1d6 void damage (basic Fortitude save); on a failed save, the target also takes a -2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.GhNVAYtoF5hK3AlD] {Spell Effect: Touch of Corruption}

If the target is a willing undead creature, the target instead regains 6 Hit Points, and if you are the undead target, you also gain a +2 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ekGHLJSHGgWMUwkY] {Touch of Corruption (Healing)}

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage dealt to a living creature by 1d6 or increase the Hit Points regained by undead by 6.
Touch of Corruption.target: 1 willing undead creature or 1 living creature

Touch of Corruption (Healing).name: Touch of Corruption (Healing)
Touch of Corruption (Healing).description:
You infuse the target with void energy. If the target is living, this deals 1d6 void damage (basic Fortitude save); on a failed save, the target also takes a -2 status penalty to AC for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.GhNVAYtoF5hK3AlD] {Spell Effect: Touch of Corruption}

If the target is a willing undead creature, the target instead regains 6 Hit Points, and if you are the undead target, you also gain a +2 status bonus to damage rolls for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.PkofF4bxkDUgeIoE] {Spell Effect: Touch of Corruption (Healing)}

Heightened (+1) Increase the damage dealt to a living creature by 1d6 or increase the Hit Points regained by undead by 6.

Touch of Obedience.name: Touch of Obedience
Touch of Obedience.description:
Your imperious touch erodes the target's willpower, making it easier to control. The target attempts a Will save. Regardless of the result, it's then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg] {Stupefied 1} until the end of your next turn.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg] {Stupefied 2} until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg] {Stupefied 2} for 1 minute and is forced to its knees, becoming prone.

Touch of Undeath.name: Touch of Undeath
Touch of Undeath.description:
You attack the target's life force with undeath, dealing 1d6 void damage. The target must attempt a Fortitude save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target takes half damage.

Failure The target takes full damage, and vitality effects heal it only half as much as normal for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target takes double damage, and vitality effects heal it only half as much as normal for 1 minute.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d6.

Touch of the Moon.name: Touch of the Moon
Touch of the Moon.description:
When you touch the target, a symbol of the moon appears on its forehead, glowing with soft moonlight. The target glows with dim light in a 20-foot radius. It also gets a benefit based on a phase of the moon, starting with the new moon and changing to the next phase at the end of each of its turns.

  • New Moon The target receives no benefit.
  • Waxing Moon The target gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls and a +4 status bonus to damage rolls.
  • Full Moon The target gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, AC, and saves, and a +4 status bonus to damage.
  • Waning Moon The target gains a +1 status bonus to AC and saving throws. After this phase, return to the new moon.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.3hDKcbhn0j6DsRgm] {Spell Effect: Touch of the Moon}

Toxic Cloud.name: Toxic Cloud
Toxic Cloud.description:
You conjure a poisonous fog. This functions as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9XHmC2JgTUIQ1CCm] {Mist} , except the area moves 10 feet away from you each round. You deal 6d8 poison damage to each breathing creature that starts its turn in the spell's area. You can Dismiss the spell.

Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d8.

Transcribe Conflict.name: Transcribe Conflict
Transcribe Conflict.description:
You cause a sheet of paper to appear in your hand, and a moment later a detailed description of a combat you experienced within the last hour is recorded on that sheet of paper in a language that you know of your choice. The description is detailed enough that anyone who spends 1 minute reading the page can attempt to Recall Knowledge about the event as if they had been there, but the primary purpose of the transcribed conflict is to give you additional insight into the fight by allowing you to study the conflict and learn from errors or tactical blunders participants in the battle may have committed.

When you cast this spell, choose a type of foe in the fight you transcribed and attempt to Recall Knowledge about that foe using your spell DC-10 instead of your skill modifier in an appropriate skill to do so. For this action, you can't use any special abilities, reactions, or free actions that trigger when you Recall Knowledge. If you are successful, you not only learn information about that foe as determined by the GM, but for the remainder of transcribe conflict's duration, you gain a +1 status bonus to Initiative checks in combats where you face that exact kind of foe. For example, if you made the check against a wrath demon, the bonus would apply only to wrath demons, not to other demons. The GM decides if a foe who is disguised grants you this bonus.

Heightened (5th) The bonus to initiative increases to +2 and the duration increases to 8 hours.

Heightened (8th) The bonus to initiative increases to +3 and the duration increases until the next time you do your daily preparations, and the status bonus to Initiative checks applies to any allies who took part in the fight you transcribed as long as they are within 30 feet of you when you cast the spell.

Transcribe Moment.name: Transcribe Moment
Transcribe Moment.description: You instantly create a small, permanent scroll that contains a magically precise written description of your current surroundings in every direction. Any creature who spends 1 minute to read the scroll-written in a language of your choice that you know-immediately sees and experiences your surroundings during the moment that you recorded (including whatever events transpired that round) exactly as you experienced it. This depiction records only what you can sense yourself. For example, if you can't see invisible creatures, the depiction doesn't reveal them even to a reader who could normally see them; a reader can't use their Perception to notice details you missed, but they can attempt a check to Recall Knowledge based on what they just experienced if they have knowledge that you lack. You can have multiple scrolls from transcribe moment in existence at the same time, up to a number equal to your Intelligence modifier. If you Cast the Spell again while already at the maximum number of scrolls, choose one of the current scrolls to lose its magic, then create the new one.

Translate.name: Translate
Translate.description:
The target can understand the meaning of a single language it is hearing or reading when you cast the spell. This doesn't let it understand codes, language couched in metaphor, and the like (subject to GM discretion). If the target can hear multiple languages and knows that, it can choose which language to understand; otherwise, choose one of the languages randomly.

Heightened (3rd) The target can also speak the language.

Heightened (4th) You can target up to 10 creatures, and targets can also speak the language.

Translocate.name: Translocate
Translocate.description:
You instantly transport yourself and any items you're wearing and holding from your current space to an unoccupied space within range you can see. If this would bring another creature with you—even if you're carrying it in an extradimensional container—the spell is lost.

Heightened (5th) The range increases to 1 mile. You don't need to be able to see your destination, as long as you have been there in the past and know its relative location and distance from you. You are then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Transmigrate.name: Transmigrate
Transmigrate.cost: heron feathers, incense, and specially prepared sakaki wood
Transmigrate.gmNote:
A slain creature whose soul became trapped between life and death in the Willowshore mindscape can't escape either back to life or into the afterlife. With the use of this ritual, you can temporarily transmigrate out of the mindscape to appear in the living world in a solid body made of ectoplasm, where you can exist for a short time in a hazy area between life and undeath.

Before casting this ritual, the PCs must construct a kiln made of earth and stone that is large enough for all of them to lie down inside of. Once the kiln is complete, the PCs must prepare beds of clay for themselves in the kiln, surrounding each one with heron feathers placed upright in the clay around the bed. When the four-hour casting of the ritual is completed, the PCs become infused with spiritual energy and must lie down on the still-wet clay beds, after which assistants come in to encase them in a three-inch-thick layer of additional clay. Short lengths of bamboo held in the mouth allow the clay-encased PCs to continue breathing. The incense and sakaki wood is then placed atop each encased PC, the kiln is closed, and the fires lit. Each PC is baked alive within their clay shells, but if the ritual is successful, they're sent into the living world as ectoplasmic apparitions.

Critical Success The clay cracks open and the PCs transmigrate into the border between life and death, a small mindscape in which they face a challenge they must overcome if they're to transmigrate into the living world. This encounter is presented on page 45 of this book. During this encounter, the PCs gain a +1 status bonus to all Strikes, saving throws, and skill checks. If they defeat the encounter, they fully transmigrate into the living world for up to 1 month, and retain a +1 status bonus to all skill checks for the first week of this month.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.8jaYbxnP4Z5wvnQs] {Spell Effect: Transmigrate (Encounter)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.FqG4zXjSoxq9qTlf] {Spell Effect: Transmigrate (Skill)}

Success As critical success, but without the status bonus to skill checks.

Failure As a critical success, but extra energy is sapped from the PCs. They gain a –1 status penalty to all Strikes, saving throws, and skill checks made in the border between life and death, and if they transmigrate to the living world, they also take a –1 status penalty to all skill checks for the first week of the ritual's month-long duration.

Critical Failure The ritual fails, and the PCs do not enter the border between life and death. Instead, they each take @Damage[9d6[fire] ] damage as they each bake in their clay shells ( @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|basic:true] save) before the failed ritual snuffs out the flames and cracks open their partially fired clay casings. The ritual can be attempted again after 24 hours have passed.

Heightened (5th) As long as the Tan Sugi stands tall above Kugaptee's grave (as it does, after the climax of the previous adventure) and Willowshore's Eternal Lantern is lit in both the mindscape and the living world, you can draw upon the artifact's power to transmigrate the entire Willowshore mindscape. This more complex version of the ritual has a cast time of 5 days and affects the entire mindscape. Furthermore, this ritual can only be attempted after the first day of the new year in the mindscape (the 72nd day of this adventure), as it also draws upon that milestone societal event to work its magic. Any attempt to cast this version of transmigrate before either of those two requirements are fulfilled causes the casting to fail as it begins, before any checks are attempted or its costs are paid. This version of the ritual must be cast near Willowshore's Eternal Lantern, which is located on the southern side of Dawnstep Bridge. As with the 4th-rank version of transmigrate, this ritual requires the creation of a kiln within 30 feet of the Eternal Lantern, within which a scale model of the town of Willowshore must be crafted from clay. On the first day of casting, the kiln itself is prepared and anointed with aromatic oils. On the second day, a platform of sakaki wood slats is built in the kiln and then anointed with additional oils. On the third day, the town of Willowshore is sculpted on the platform from clay. On the fourth day, heron feathers and sticks of incense are placed in the sculpture's still drying clay; the sticks of incense are lit and continually replaced through the day as they burn. Finally, on the fifth day, the kiln is lit and the sculpture is fired. The next day, as the people of Willowshore awaken from the ritual, its effects become apparent. See "Concluding the Adventure" on page 61 and Chapter 1 of the next adventure for more details.

Critical Success The Willowshore mindscape transmigrates wholly into the living world. The full extent of what transmigrates depends on how many Preparation Points remain unspent at the end of this adventure, but the Critical Success at this ritual grants the party an additional 12 Preparation Points to determine this success, as detailed at the start of the next adventure.

Success As critical success, without bonus Preparation Points.

Failure The ritual fails, but a new attempt can be made after 24 hours have passed.

Critical Failure As failure, but the failed ritual also spreads waves of despair through town, causing food stores to rot away and buildings to take damage as if affected by years of neglect. The party loses 12 of their remaining Preparation Points, deducted as they see fit from Hope Points, Food Points, and Security Points. If the party can't deduct the full 12 points from their remaining Preparation Points, reduce all points to 0. Their next attempt to cast the ritual at 5th-rank takes a –2 status penalty to its checks.
Transmigrate.secondarycheck: Crafting, Nature, Society, or Willowshore Lore

Transmute Rock And Mud.name: Transmute Rock And Mud
Transmute Rock And Mud.description:
You warp the structure of earthen material, turning rock into mud or mud into rock. Choose one of these two options when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.aBQ8ajvEBByv45yz] {Cast the Spell} .

• Rock to Mud You transform non-magical, unworked, and unattended stone in the area into an equal volume of mud. If you Cast this Spell on a stone floor, it becomes difficult terrain; if the resulting mud is at least 3 feet deep, it is greater difficult terrain, or the creature can try to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.c8TGiZ48ygoSPofx] {Swim} through it ( @Check[type:athletics|dc:10|traits:action:swim] ). If the mud is deep enough that a creature can't reach the bottom, the creature must Swim to move through it. If you Cast this Spell on a ceiling, the falling mud deals @Damage[8d6[bludgeoning] ] damage (basic Reflex save) and spreads out, creating difficult terrain in an area 10 feet larger in radius than the original spell's area. Once the rock is transformed into mud, the mud is non-magical and remains until natural conditions cause it to dry out or otherwise disperse.

• Mud to Rock Mud in the area turns into unworked stone. If creatures are in the mud when it is transformed to stone, they must attempt a Reflex saving throw.

Critical Success The creature escapes the mud and is atop the stone, unaffected.

Success The creature climbs out of the mud as it turns to rock and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone} atop the stone.

Failure The creature is partially stuck in the mud and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei] {Grabbed} for 1 round or until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9] {Escapes} , whichever comes first.

Critical Failure The creature is entirely stuck. It is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM] {Restrained} for 1 round or until it Escapes, whichever comes first.

Heightened (+2) Add an additional 10-foot cube to the area, adjacent to at least one of the other cubes.

Traveler's Transit.name: Traveler's Transit
Traveler's Transit.description:
You add power to your muscles, allowing you to swim or climb walls with ease. When you Cast this Spell, you gain either a climb Speed or a swim Speed. The Speed is equal to your land Speed.

Heightened (5th) You can choose to gain a fly Speed.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.Ig9p2rDXGYHpEuTx] {Spell Effect: Traveler's Transit}

Tree of Seasons.name: Tree of Seasons
Tree of Seasons.description:
You cause a Small tree to instantly sprout in an unoccupied space on the ground. Four seedpods grow from the tree, each filled with the magic of a different one of the four seasons. A creature can Interact to pluck one of the pods, and can then either throw it up to 30 feet as part of the same action or do so with a separate Interact action later. When thrown, a pod explodes in a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] , dealing 6d6 damage with a basic Reflex save against your spell DC. The damage type depends on the season of the pod: electricity for spring, fire for summer, poison for autumn, or cold for winter. When the spell ends, the tree withers away and any remaining pods rot, leaving behind non-magical seeds.

@Damage[(@item.level)d6[cold] ]

@Damage[(@item.level)d6[electricity] ]

@Damage[(@item.level)d6[fire] ]

@Damage[(@item.level)d6[poison] ]

Heightened (+1) The burst's damage increases by 1d6.

Tremor Signs.name: Tremor Signs
Tremor Signs.description:
You send a series of tremors, no longer than a short sentence of speech, toward your target. If the target is within range and connected to the same body of earth as you, the vibrations reach the target through the ground. You need neither line of sight nor line of effect, so a target on another floor of a building is a valid target.

The target can give a brief, vibrational response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn, but they must be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered to you through tremors you feel, as with the original message. The tremors impart a clear meaning only if you and the target know that meaning, such as three tremors for a specific warning, two for another. Neither of you can impart a nuanced or new meaning using this spell.

A creature that has tremorsense can feel the vibrations from this spell if the creature is within range of the vibrations at any point during their journey to any target.

Heightened (4th) The spell can target up to 5 creatures.

Tremorsense.name: Tremorsense
Tremorsense.description:
You become aware of vibrations in the ground around you. You gain tremorsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet. As normal for tremorsense, you can detect a creature only if it's on the same surface as you and only if the subject is moving along (or burrowing through) the surface.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.7cYUiOONB2lZfSaA] {Spell Effect: Tremorsense}

Heightened (3rd) The spell's duration is 1 hour.

Heightened (5th) The spell's duration is 8 hours.

Trickster's Twin.name: Trickster's Twin
Trickster's Twin.description:
You rarely settle for being in just one place. Choose a location within 100 feet of the target that the target can see. You create an illusion of yourself there that only it can see and that mimics all your actions. The target must attempt a Will save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target believes you're in the designated location and can't see you in your actual location. The target automatically disbelieves the illusion when you use an action that doesn't make sense in the illusion's position, or if the target attacks, touches, Seeks, or otherwise engages with the illusion. If you use a hostile action against the target, the spell ends.

Failure As success, but the target must succeed at a Will save to disbelieve the illusion when one of the listed events occurs.

Critical Failure As success, but the target must critically succeed at a Will save to disbelieve when one of the listed events occurs.

Triple Time.name: Triple Time
Triple Time.description:
Your music sets a fast pace. You and all allies in the area gain a +10-foot status bonus to all Speeds for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.HtaDbgTIzdiTiKLX] {Spell Effect: Triple Time}

True Target.name: True Target
True Target.description: You delve into the possible futures of the next few seconds to understand all the ways your foe might avoid harm, then cast out a vision of that future to those around you. Designate a creature. The first time each target makes an attack roll against that creature during true target's duration, the attacker rolls twice and uses the better result. The attacker also ignores circumstance penalties to the attack roll and any flat check required due to the designated creature being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W] {Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC] {Hidden} .

Truesight.name: Truesight
Truesight.description: You see things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion, morph or polymorph effect in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether you see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, you can see the creature's true form, but you don't end the polymorph spell).

Truespeech.name: Truespeech
Truespeech.description:
The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

Heightened (7th) The duration is 8 hours.

Umbral Extraction.name: Umbral Extraction
Umbral Extraction.description:
You prepare to steal spells from your foes, ripping them from the foe's shadow to stow them in an ephemeral pocket in the Shadow Plane. You gain a temporary spell slot, which you can fill only by stealing a spell from an enemy spellcaster. During umbral extraction's duration, you can use the Steal action to attempt to take one of the foe's prepared spells or unused spontaneous spell slots instead of an item. You can also make one attempt to Steal as part of Casting umbral extraction . If you succeed at your check to Steal a spell, you deal 1d4 mental damage to the target per rank of the spell stolen due to the psychological toll of the spiritual emptiness created by wrenching the spell away, and you place the stolen spell in your temporary spell slot. It gains the shadow trait if cast from this temporary slot.

Determine the stolen spell at random from the target's spells that are 1 rank lower than umbral extraction , or from spells of the same rank if you got a critical success. If the target has no spell slots of that rank, use the highest rank below that in which the target does have a spell slot. (If the target has no eligible spells, you get nothing, but you can continue to attempt to Steal spells for the remaining duration.) If the target is a prepared caster, you randomly steal one of their prepared spells. If the target is a spontaneous caster, you instead steal an unexpended spell slot of the appropriate rank and determine the spell at random from all the target's known spells at that level. You can't steal a target's innate spells, focus spells, or cantrips. You know what the spell is as soon as you steal it, and your temporary spell slot becomes a spell slot of the same rank as the spell you stole.

As normal, you can Steal only from a target within your reach. Once you've placed a spell in your temporary spell slot, you can't attempt to Steal more spells. If you succeed at your Thievery check, you must take the spell you stole. Even if you're a spontaneous caster, you can use the temporary spell slot only to cast the stolen spell and you can cast only the stolen spell from your temporary spell slot. When umbral extraction ends, you lose the temporary spell slot and any spell still stored in it. When you cast umbral extraction , any previous casting of umbral extraction currently affecting you ends.

Umbral Graft.name: Umbral Graft
Umbral Graft.description:
You reflect a spell into a shadowy version of itself, in the process depleting the power of the initial spell. During umbral graft's duration, you can use the Steal action to attempt to abscond with spells affecting a foe instead of stealing an item. You can also make one attempt to Steal as part of Casting umbral graft . If you succeed at your check to Steal a spell, randomly determine a spell affecting the foe that has a target entry. That spell ceases to affect the target, and you can either cause the spell to affect you or store it in your shadow. If your attempt to Steal was a critical success, you automatically steal the spell if its rank is equal to or lower than umbral graft. If it was a success, you automatically steal it if its rank is lower than umbral graft. If you succeeded, but the spell's rank was too high to steal automatically, you must attempt a counteract check to see if you steal the spell. You know what the spell is as soon as you steal it. If you store it, you can transfer it to a willing creature as a single action that has the manipulate trait. The spell lasts for its remaining duration, to a maximum of 1 minute, and any time you keep it stored subtracts from its duration normally. The spell gains the shadow trait.

You can't steal constant innate spells that are always active on a creature, such as a choral angel's constant tongues, or innate spells that have special restrictions that remove their ability to target other creatures, such as an imp's invisibility. At the GM's discretion, you might not be able to steal innate spells with other unusual modifications to the base spell.

As normal, you can Steal only from a target within your reach. Once you've stolen a spell, you can't attempt to Steal more spells, nor can you choose not to take a spell if you succeed at your Thievery check. When you cast umbral graft, any spells you stole with a previous umbral graft end even if their duration hasn't elapsed. If you're affected by both umbral graft and umbral extraction, you make the choice whether to steal a spell slot, an active spell, or an item each time you Steal.

Umbral Journey.name: Umbral Journey
Umbral Journey.description: You move partially into the Netherworld, using its warped nature to speed your travels. Each hour, you cover roughly as much ground as you normally would in 3 days. The landmarks are vague and symbolic rather than concrete, leaving you within a mile of your intended destination when you Dismiss the spell or its duration ends
Umbral Journey.target: you and up to 10 willing creatures touched

Umbral Mindtheft.name: Umbral Mindtheft
Umbral Mindtheft.description: You prepare to steal a broad field of knowledge from another creature, siphoning it from their mind and storing it in a pocket of the Shadow Plane connected to your own mind. During the spell's duration, you can use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k] {Steal} action to attempt to take one Lore skill proficiency from a creature instead of Stealing an item. You can also make one attempt to Steal as part of Casting the Spell. If you succeed at your check to Steal a Lore skill, you deal 2d6 mental damage to the target if they were trained in that skill, plus @Damage[2d6[mental] ] damage per proficiency rank they have in that skill above trained, as the sudden loss of knowledge leaves an aching absence in the target's mind. Determine the Lore skill at random from among those known by the target; on a critical success, you learn what Lore skills the creature is proficient in and can select the skill rather than choosing at random. If the target isn't trained in any Lore skills, you get nothing, but you can continue to attempt to Steal Lore from other creatures for the remaining duration. The target loses the benefits of its training in that Lore skill, and you gain their proficiency rank in that Lore skill. This effect lasts until your next daily preparations or until you are incapacitated, in which case the Lore siphons back into the target creature's mind from the Shadow Plane, wherever you both may be. As normal, you can Steal only from a target within your reach. Once you've stolen one Lore skill, you can't attempt to Steal more Lore. If you succeed at your Thievery check, you must take the Lore you stole.

Unblinking Flame Aura.name: Unblinking Flame Aura
Unblinking Flame Aura.description:
You focus your sight inside and call on your inner fire to grant you warmth, steady your vision, and soothe your body. You recover [[/r (3*@item.level)[healing]] ] {15 Hit Points} . For the duration, you gain a +2 status bonus on Perception checks and resistance 10 to cold.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.HoCUCi2jL1OLfXWR] {Spell Effect: Unblinking Flame Aura}

Heightened (+1) You recover an additional 3 Hit Points, and the resistance to cold increases by 2.

Unblinking Flame Emblem.name: Unblinking Flame Emblem
Unblinking Flame Emblem.description:
Trigger Your last action was a successful Strike against an enemy

You emblazon the target with a fiery sigil that projects your sight and your flame onto them, allowing you and your allies to track their movements and making it easier to hit them. Attack rolls against the target gain a +1 status bonus, and successful Strikes against the target deal @Damage[1d6[fire] ] damage, and @Damage[1d10[persistent,fire] ] damage on a critical hit. However, you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] {Off-Guard} against other enemies, as the information from the emblem distracts you. The emblem takes your full attention; if you use unblinking flame emblem again before the original duration expires, the new casting replaces the previous casting.

Heightened (9th) The fire damage increases to @Damage[1d8[fire] ] damage, and the persistent fire damage on a critical hit increases to @Damage[1d12[persistent,fire] ].

Unblinking Flame Ignition.name: Unblinking Flame Ignition
Unblinking Flame Ignition.description:
Trigger A foe reduces you to half your Hit Points or fewer.

You feel the most alive when pushed into a corner, as the insights and vision granted by the flame stoke into overdrive. Your body begins to emit a blazing aura of flames. You gain greater darkvision, low‐light vision, and the ability to see invisible creatures. You gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed as you launch flame from your aura to soar through the sky. You become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl] {Quickened} , and you can use the extra action each round only to Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p] {Fly} using your flames. Any creature who starts their turn within 5 feet of you takes @Damage[1d12[fire] ] damage.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.hya8NfBB1GJofTXm] {Spell Effect: Unblinking Flame Ignition}

Unblinking Flame Revelation.name: Unblinking Flame Revelation
Unblinking Flame Revelation.description: You light your foe with revealing flame. The GM attempts a secret counteract check against each illusion affecting the creature; on a success, you suppress the illusion for the duration, rather than end the effect.

Unbreaking Wave Advance.name: Unbreaking Wave Advance
Unbreaking Wave Advance.description:
You unleash a mighty wave from your hand that buffets back your foes. Each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude saving throw. If a creature pushed by unbreaking wave advance would be pushed into a solid barrier or another creature, it stops at that point and takes 3d6 damage.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature is pushed 10 feet.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 20 feet.

Heightened (+1) The damage for pushing a creature into a solid barrier increases by 1d6.

Unbreaking Wave Barrier.name: Unbreaking Wave Barrier
Unbreaking Wave Barrier.description:
You create a protective circle around yourself that repels your foes. You gain a +1 status bonus to AC. Any creature other than you within the area, or attempting to move into the area, must attempt a Fortitude saving throw; a creature needs to attempt the Fortitude saving throw only once each round. If a creature pushed by unbreaking wave barrier would be pushed into a solid barrier or another creature, it stops at that point and takes @Damage[2d6[bludgeoning] ] damage for every additional 5 feet it would've been pushed. On subsequent rounds, the first time you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3f5DMFu8fPiqHpRg] {Sustain} this Spell each round, you can increase the radius of the barrier by 5 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.v09uwq1eHEAy2bgh] {Spell Effect: Unbreaking Wave Barrier}

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature isn't pushed, but the space within the barrier is difficult terrain for it.

Failure The creature is pushed 10 feet, and the space within the barrier is difficult terrain for it.

Critical Failure The creature is pushed 20 feet and knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone} , and the space within the barrier is difficult terrain for it.

Unbreaking Wave Containment.name: Unbreaking Wave Containment
Unbreaking Wave Containment.description: You wrap enemies in four strands of water. When you cast the spell, make a spell attack roll against the targets. On a success, they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe] {Immobilized} until the spell ends or they @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9] {Escape} ; on a critical success, they're also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM] {Restrained} until the spell ends or they Escape. Each target that's immobilized or restrained also takes 10d6 bludgeoning damage from the constricting waves, with a basic Fortitude save. The first time each subsequent round when you sustain the Spell, if all the targets aren't immobilized or restrained, make a spell attack roll against any targets who are free but remain within range, with the same effects as when you cast the spell, immobilizing or restraining them depending on your spell attack roll. Creatures who are immobilized or restrained take 10d6 bludgeoning damage with a basic Fortitude save.

Unbreaking Wave Vapor.name: Unbreaking Wave Vapor
Unbreaking Wave Vapor.description:
Trigger You're targeted by an attack made by an attacker you can see.

You're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W] {Concealed} against the triggering attack and gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against it. After the triggering attack is complete, you can Step if the triggering attack hit or Step twice if the triggering attack missed.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.m6x0IvoeX0a0bZiQ] {Spell Effect: Unbreaking Wave Vapor}

Uncontrollable Dance.name: Uncontrollable Dance
Uncontrollable Dance.description:
The target is overcome with an all-consuming urge to dance. For the duration of the spell, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] {Off-Guard} and can't use reactions. While affected, the creature can't use move actions except to dance, using the Stride action to move up to half its Speed.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The spell's duration is 3 rounds, and the target must spend at least 1 action each turn dancing.

Failure The spell's duration is 1 minute, and the target must spend at least 2 actions each turn dancing.

Critical Failure The spell's duration is 1 minute, and the target must spend all its actions each turn dancing.

Undeath's Blessing.name: Undeath's Blessing
Undeath's Blessing.description:
Inculcas dentro de una criatura el toque de la tumba. Mientras dura, los hechizos @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz] {Harm} y ​​@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs] {Heal} tratan a la criatura como un no-muerto. Además, los hechizos de daño obtienen una bonificación de estado de +2 a los puntos de vida restaurados al objetivo.

Si el objetivo desea evitar el hechizo, puede intentar una salvación de Voluntad para reducir los efectos.

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado.

Éxito El objetivo se cura la mitad de cura y ​​recibe la mitad de daño de daña durante 1 ronda.

Fallo Efectos según lo descrito en el texto.

Incrementado (+1) La bonificación de estado a los puntos de vida restaurados aumenta en 2.

Undermine Reality.name: Socavar la realidad
Undermine Reality.description:
Azotas a un objetivo con zarcillos de sombra que roban parte de su sustancia, haciéndolo casi real. Mientras sea casi real, sus golpes causan la mitad del daño, no puede tener éxito crítico en ninguna prueba de habilidad y las criaturas que intentan realizar tiradas de salvación contra sus hechizos y efectos obtienen un resultado un grado de éxito mejor que el obtenido. El objetivo debe intentar una tirada de salvación de Voluntad.

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado.

Éxito El objetivo es casi real hasta el final de su siguiente turno.

Fallo El objetivo es casi real durante 1 minuto. Al final de cada uno de sus turnos, puede intentar otra salvación de Voluntad, finalizando el hechizo si tiene éxito.

Fallo crítico El objetivo es casi real por una duración ilimitada.

Undertaker.name: enterrador
Undertaker.description:
Señalas con el dedo hacia el objetivo y susurras un epitafio que promete adornar su lápida en un futuro cercano. Este hechizo funciona mejor cuando tanto tú como el objetivo están en contacto con tierra firme. Si alguno de los dos no está en contacto con el suelo, el objetivo gana un bonificador de circunstancia +2 en su tirada de salvación contra el hechizo, y si ni tú ni el objetivo estáis en contacto con suelo sólido, el objetivo gana este bonificador y trata el resultado. de su salvación como un grado deéxito mejor que el resultado real. El objetivo del enterrador puede resistir con una salvación de Fortaleza.

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado.

Éxito El objetivo sufre @Damage[40[void] ] de daño. Si el objetivo está en contacto con suelo sólido, el suelo en el espacio del objetivo se mueve y tiembla, y se trata como terreno difícil hasta el comienzo de tu siguiente turno.

Fallo El objetivo sufre @Damage[80[void] ] de daño. Si el objetivo está en contacto con tierra sólida, el suelo en el espacio del objetivo se agita y se agrieta formando una tumba abierta pero poco profunda. El objetivo es derribado @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone} y ​​ese espacio se trata como terreno difícil hasta que se rellena la tumba.

Fallo crítico El objetivo sufre @Damage[160[void] ] de daño. Si el objetivo está en contacto contierra firme, una tumba se abre bajo sus pies y caen boca abajo. Luego, la tumba forma un caparazón de piedra parecido a un sarcófago alrededor de la víctima. Esta cáscara de piedra no se puede abrir y debe romperse; tiene CA 10, Dureza 14 y 80 puntos de vida. Al comienzo de tu siguiente turno, la tumba se llena de tierra. Si la víctima muere mientras está dentro de esta tumba, en la siguiente puesta de sol la víctima se transforma en un espectro maligno cuando el sarcófago se desmorona, permitiendo que los nuevos no-muertos excaven hasta la superficie.

Unexpected Transposition.name: Transposición inesperada
Unexpected Transposition.description:
Activador Eres el objetivo del ataque de un enemigo.

Cuando te atacan, intentas intercambiar rápidamente tu propia posición con la de otra criatura. Una criatura que no esté dispuesta a intercambiar lugares contigo debe intentar una salvación de Voluntad. Las criaturas dispuestas fracasan automáticamente. Si cambias de lugar con éxito con el objetivo, el ataque desencadenante se resuelve contra esa criatura como si hubiera sido el objetivo original del ataque.Después del intercambio, tanto tú como el objetivo sois temporalmente inmunes a hechizos de transposición inesperados durante 1 minuto. Cambias de lugar automáticamente si el objetivo está dispuesto. Si no está dispuesto, puede intentar una salvación de Voluntad. Ninguno de los dos se teletransporta si el objetivo tiene éxito en su salvación.
Unexpected Transposition.target: 1 criatura que no sea el enemigo desencadenante

Unfathomable Song.name: Canción insondable
Unfathomable Song.description:
Notas fugaces de una canción extraña y antinatural llenan el aire, superando la mente. Cada objetivo debe intentar una salvación de Voluntad cuando lanzas el hechizo, y nuevamente la primera vez que sostienes este hechizo en cada ronda. Una criatura solo necesita intentar una salvación contra la canción en cada ronda, y debes mantener los mismos objetivos cuando sostienes el hechizo.

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado, no puede verse afectado en posterioresrondas y es temporalmente inmune durante 1 minuto.

Éxito El objetivo no se ve afectado en esta ronda, pero puede verse afectado en rondas posteriores.

Fallo Tira [[/r 1d4]] en la siguiente tabla.

Fallo crítico Tira [[/r 1d4+1]] en la siguiente tabla.

Resultado Efecto
1 El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL] {Frightened 2}
2 El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ] {Confused} durante 1 ronda
3 El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg] {Stupefied 4} durante 1 ronda
4 El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2] {Blinded} durante 1 ronda
5 El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix] {Stunned} durante 1 ronda y @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg] {Stupefied 1} por una duración ilimitada

Unfetter Eidolon.name: Eidolón liberador
Unfetter Eidolon.description: Aflojas el vínculo entre tú y tu eidolon, permitiéndole viajar más lejos de ti durante un corto período de tiempo. Mientras el hechizo está activo, tu eidolon puede viajar una distancia ilimitada lejos de ti. Cuando el hechizo termina, si tu eidolon está a más de 100 pies de ti, no se manifiesta.

Unfettered Mark.name: Marca sin restricciones
Unfettered Mark.cost: tintas y agujas raras por un valor total de 100 po × el rango del hechizo × el nivel del objetivo
Unfettered Mark.description:
Tatuas al objetivo con tintas raras y creas un tatuaje mágico llamado marca sin restricciones . Esta versión particular de la marca sin restricciones otorga al objetivo poderes especiales para escapar de la Ballena Negra y Stormholt (el semiplano que se superpone con la Ballena Negra). Si bien la elaboración es el método más sencillo para crear este tatuaje, el arte es menos importante que mantener una sensación de libertad en tu mente mientras realizas el tatuaje.ritual. Debido a esto, puedes usar cualquier habilidad siempre que tenga un significado especial para ti. Un guardabosques que esté en su casa en el bosque, por ejemplo, podría utilizar una prueba de Supervivencia o Naturaleza mientras crea el tatuaje. Si el objetivo ya tiene una marca exitosa sin restricciones actualmente activa, la magia se desvanece del antiguo tatuaje y es reemplazada por los resultados del nuevo ritual.

El ritual se puede realizar solo o con la ayuda de hasta 10 secundarios.ruedas. Cada lanzador secundario debe tatuarse con su propio tatuaje y pagar el costo total del ritual para participar. Las criaturas actualmente cautivas en la prisión tienen una relación especial con el ritual: por cada mes que pasan dibujando recuerdos de su hogar en las paredes de su celda, pueden reducir el coste total del ritual en 50 po.

Éxito crítico El objetivo y los lanzadores primarios y secundarios obtienen la capacidad deabandona Stormholt. Para ello, deberán salir de la prisión nadando por el agua o montando en una embarcación que esté en contacto con el agua (como un bote de remos). Cuando llegan al gran remolino, son arrastrados hacia abajo como de costumbre, pero en lugar de ser transportados al Cementerio de restos de restos en Absalom, son transportados inmediatamente (como @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.69L70wKfGDY66Mk9] {Teleport}) a un lugar en Absalom de su elección. También obtienen los beneficios de @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2] {Water Walk} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.MZGkMsPBztFN0pUO] {Water Breathing} ,y resistencia a la electricidad 10 durante la duración del ritual.

Éxito Como éxito crítico, excepto que las criaturas afectadas no obtienen los beneficios de paseo acuático y ​​ respiración acuática .

Fracaso Creas el tatuaje pero no logras imbuirlo de magia.

Fallo crítico Como fallo,pero el tatuaje también crea un vínculo nocivo con el semiplano de Stormholt. Durante 24 horas, el objetivo y los lanzadores primarios y secundarios adquieren una apariencia de pez y quedan cubiertos por una membrana viscosa. Obtienen la capacidad de respirar tanto agua como aire, pero su piel se seca rápidamente cuando están en tierra. Después de 1 hora en tierra se convierten en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR] {Drained 1} y ​​@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw] {Fatigued}, condiciones que pueden eliminarse sólo si vuelven a entrar al agua. Además, la membrana conducepozo de electricidad, lo que les hace ganar debilidad 10 a la electricidad.

Unfettered Movement.name: Movimiento sin restricciones
Unfettered Movement.description: Repeles efectos que obstaculizarían a una criatura o ralentizarían su movimiento. Mientras esté bajo el efecto de este hechizo, el objetivo ignora los efectos que le darían una penalización circunstancial a la Velocidad. Cuando intentan @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9] {Escape} un efecto que les tiene @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe] {Immobilized} , @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei] {Grabbed} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM] {Restrained} , automáticamente tienen éxito a menos que el efecto sea mágico y de un rango superior al del hechizo movimiento sin restricciones .

Unfettered Pack.name: Paquete sin restricciones
Unfettered Pack.description:
Liberas a quienes viajan contigo de obstáculos ambientales. Los objetivos no toman penalizaciones por circunstancias a la velocidad debido a la vegetación, escombros, vientos u otras propiedades del entorno, e ignoran el terreno difícil debido a dichas propiedades ambientales.

Intensificado (9º) Los objetivos también ignoran terrenos más difíciles de las propiedades ambientales.

Unfolding Wind Blitz.name: Bombardeo de viento en desarrollo
Unfolding Wind Blitz.description: Avanzas tan rápido que te elevas por el aire y nada puede reaccionar ante ti. Vuela hasta el doble de tu velocidad. Este movimiento no provoca reacciones. En cualquier punto del camino podrás realizar Strikes con un ataque desarmado contra hasta tres objetivos diferentes a tu alcance. Aumentas tu penalización de ataques múltiples para estos ataques solo después de completar todos los ataques.

Unfolding Wind Buffet.name: Buffet de viento desplegable
Unfolding Wind Buffet.description:
Rodeas tus ataques desarmados con la velocidad y la fuerza del aire. Realiza tres ataques desarmados contra el mismo objetivo. Si al menos uno fue un golpe exitoso, el objetivo debe intentar una salvación de Fortaleza o ser empujado hacia atrás 5 pies por cada golpe normal del buffet, más 10 pies por cada golpe crítico.

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado.

Éxito El objetivo es empujadoretroceda la mitad de la distancia normal.

Fallo El objetivo es empujado hacia atrás la distancia normal.

Fallo crítico El objetivo es empujado hacia atrás el doble de la distancia normal y luego derribado @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone} .

Unfolding Wind Crash.name: Choque de viento que se desarrolla
Unfolding Wind Crash.description:
Saltas hasta 120 pies en cualquier dirección y luego infliges 18d6 de daño contundente a las criaturas dentro de una emanación de 20 pies después de aterrizar, con una salvación de Reflejos básica. Las criaturas que fallan críticamente también son noqueadas @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone}.

Incrementado (10º) El daño aumenta a 20d6.

Unfolding Wind Rush.name: La ráfaga de viento que se desarrolla
Unfolding Wind Rush.description:
Viajas con un viento fuerte. Muévete dos veces: dos zancadas, dos pasos o una zancada y un paso (en cualquier orden). Puedes dar zancadas o dar pasos en el aire durante este movimiento, moviéndote hacia arriba en un ángulo de 45 grados como máximo; si finalizas tu movimiento en el aire, caes después de realizar una acción o cuando finaliza tu turno, lo que ocurra primero. Un @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.it4ZsAi6XgvGcodc] {Wall of Wind} aparece en todos los espacios que dejaste durante este movimiento, con una duración de 1 ronda.

Intensificado (5º) El muro de viento dura 3 rondas.

Unimpeded Stride.name: Paso sin obstáculos
Unimpeded Stride.description: La gracia divina asegura que nada pueda mantenerte prisionero o detenerte. Escapas inmediatamente de cada efecto mágico que te tenga @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe] {Immobilized} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei] {Grabbed} a menos que el efecto sea de un nivel superior a tu hechizo de zancada sin obstáculos. Entonces tú caminas. Durante este movimiento, ignoras el terreno difícil y cualquier circunstancia o penalización de estado a tu Velocidad.

Unity.name: Unidad
Unity.description:
Activador Tú y 1 o más aliados dentro del alcance sois objetivo de un hechizo o habilidad que permite una tirada de salvación.

Ustedes presentaron una defensa unida. Cada aliado puede usar tu modificador de tiro de salvación en lugar del suyo propio contra el hechizo desencadenante. Cada aliado decide individualmente qué modificador usar.
Unity.target: cada aliado objetivo del hechizo desencadenante

Unraveling Blast.name: Explosión desenredante
Unraveling Blast.description:
Desatas una pequeña explosión de potencial que destruye uno de los posibles futuros de una criatura, dejándola tambaleante. Infliges 2d4 de daño mental a la criatura y esta debe intentar una salvación de Voluntad.

Éxito crítico La criatura no se ve afectada.

Éxito La criatura sufre la mitad del daño mental.

Fallo La criatura tomadaño total y es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] {Off-Guard} hasta el inicio de su turno.

Fallo crítico La criatura recibe el doble de daño, se convierte en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix] {Stunned 1} y ​​está desprevenida hasta el comienzo de tu siguiente turno.

Incrementado (+1) El daño aumenta en 3d4.

Unrelenting Observation.name: Observación implacable
Unrelenting Observation.description:
Este hechizo otorga una visión perfecta basada en la visión, lo que permite que varios objetivos dispuestos rastreen los movimientos o la posición exactos de una criatura u objeto. Elige una criatura u objeto objetivo en el área a rastrear. Se convierte en el sensor del hechizo. Hasta cinco criaturas voluntarias de tu elección en el área pueden ver una imagen fantasmal de esta criatura u objeto cuando está fuera de su vista. Pueden percibir la criatura u objeto perfectamente, lo que les permite ignorar el @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} o @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML] {Invisible} condición, aunque las barreras físicas aún brindan cobertura.

Las criaturas rastreadoras pueden ver la criatura u objeto rastreado a través de todas las barreras que no sean plomo o agua corriente, que bloquean su visión. La distancia no importa, aunque la criatura u objeto puede alejarse tanto que se vuelve demasiado pequeño para percibirlo. Las criaturas rastreadoras no ven nada del entorno alrededor del objetivo, aunque sí ven cualquier equipo en el que se encuentre la criatura.llevar o sostener, y pueden saber si quita objetos de su persona.

Si el objetivo a rastrear está dispuesto, la duración es de 1 hora. Si intentas rastrear a una criatura que no está dispuesta, el objetivo debe intentar una salvación de Voluntad.

Éxito crítico La criatura u objeto no se ve afectado.

Éxito Tal como se describe y la duración es de 1 minuto.

Fallo Tal como se describe, y la duración es de 1 hora.
Unrelenting Observation.target: 1 criatura u objeto rastreado y hasta otras 5 criaturas voluntarias

Unseasonable Squall.name: Chubasca fuera de temporada
Unseasonable Squall.description:
Emites una ráfaga de viento repentina que se extiende hacia afuera desde el centro de la ráfaga. El viento extingue pequeños fuegos no mágicos, dispersa niebla y neblina, dispersa objetos de volumen ligero o menos y empuja objetos no asegurados de 1 volumen o menos a 5 pies de distancia del punto de origen del hechizo. Cada criatura mediana o más pequeña en el área cuando lanzas el hechizo o que se mueve al área del hechizo debe intentar una tirada de salvación de Fortaleza.

Éxito La criatura no se ve afectada.

Fallo La criatura es noqueada @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone} . Si la criatura estaba volando, en su lugar obtiene un fallo crítico.

Fallo crítico La criatura es empujada a 30 pies de distancia del centro de la explosión, queda derribada y sufre 2d6 de daño contundente.

Unseen Custodians.name: Custodios invisibles
Unseen Custodians.cost: Aceites, sales y hierbas raros por un valor total de 15 po.
Unseen Custodians.description:
Creas un efecto de hechizo @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xqmHD8JIjak15lRk] {Phantasmal Minion} duradero y vinculado al sitio, formando entidades de fuerza pura para llevar a cabo tareas básicas en una ubicación fija.

Éxito crítico El ritual crea seis sirvientes invisibles. No necesitas concentrarte en ellos y no son minions convocados. Puedes gastar una acción, que tenga el rasgo de concentración, para ordenarle a uno que realice una tarea básica; continúa realizando la tarea hastaordenó de nuevo.

Éxito Como éxito crítico, pero el ritual crea tres sirvientes invisibles.

Fracaso El ritual no logra crear ningún sirviente.

Fallo crítico El ritual crea seis sirvientes invisibles, pero estas criaturas son hostiles y capaces de cerrar el puño @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR] {Strikes} con una bonificación de ataque igual a tu modificador de habilidad.para la prueba de habilidad principal, que inflige @Damage[1d6[force] ] de daño. Te atacan a ti y a tus aliados e intentan romper objetos que te pertenecen a ti y a tus aliados dentro del área.

Intensificado (6º) Si son destruidos, los sirvientes invisibles se reforman a la mañana siguiente. El coste aumenta a 30 po.
Unseen Custodians.secondarycheck: Arcanos u Ocultismo (lo que no se use para la verificación principal), Diplomacia

Unseen Heralds.name: Heraldos invisibles
Unseen Heralds.cost: Aceites, sales y hierbas raros por un valor total de 15 po.
Unseen Heralds.description:
Aunque este hechizo se ha extendido por todo el Mar Interior, probablemente vino primero de Nex, donde se utiliza para generar alarmas o notificar a la población sobre nuevas políticas. En cualquier caso, el ritual funciona colocando varias ilusiones simples por toda el área, permitiendo al lanzador transmitir su voz por toda el área.

Éxito crítico El ritual crea seis "bocas", como @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.eIQ86FOXK34HiNLs] {Embed Message}, en los lugares que seleccionesdentro del área. Al realizar una sola acción con el rasgo de concentración, puedes ordenar a las bocas que hablen: pueden decir lo que quieras y puedes configurarlas para que repitan mensajes o anuncios en el intervalo que elijas. También puedes optar por que sólo hablen determinadas bocas. Cualquier lanzador secundario que incluyas en el ritual, incluso más allá de los dos requeridos, puede hablar por la boca de la misma manera que tú.

Éxito Como éxito crítico, peroel ritual crea tres bocas.

Fracaso El ritual no tiene efecto.

Fallo crítico Las bocas se forman y rápidamente comienzan a gritar, balbucear y/o maldecir a los transeúntes; es imposible descansar o relajarse dentro del alcance auditivo de las bocas hasta que su magia se agote en aproximadamente un día.

Intensificado (6º) El área del ritual ahora es de 1 milla × 1 milla y produce 30 bocas (60 en caso de éxito crítico). El coste del ritual aumenta a 300 po.

Incrementado (9º) El área del ritual ahora es de 100 millas × 100 millas y produce 500 bocas (1000 en caso de éxito crítico). Puedes colocar cubrebocas en base a criterios. El coste del ritual aumenta a 5.000 po.
Unseen Heralds.secondarycheck: Arcanos u Ocultismo (lo que no se use para la verificación principal), Diplomacia

Unspeakable Shadow.name: Sombra indescriptible
Unspeakable Shadow.description:
Alteras la sombra de una criatura, transformándola en un monstruo aterrador que quiere devorarla. La criatura debe intentar una salvación de Voluntad. Una criatura que tiene la condición asustada de sombra indescriptible debe gastar al menos una de sus acciones cada turno para atacar su sombra (haciendo un Golpe ineficaz) o huir de su sombra (usando una acción para alejarse como si tuviera la condición de huida).

Éxito crítico El objetivo no se ve afectado.

Éxito El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL] {Frightened 2} .

Fallo El objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL] {Frightened 3} . No puede reducir su valor de miedo por debajo de 1 durante 1 minuto.

Fallo crítico El objetivo tiene tanto miedo que podría morir instantáneamente. Debe tener éxito en una salvación de Fortaleza omorir; esta tirada de salvación tiene el rasgo de incapacitación. Si tiene éxito en su salvación, el objetivo es @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL] {Frightened 4} y ​​no puede reducir su valor de miedo por debajo de 1 durante 1 minuto.

Untamed Form.name: Forma indómita
Untamed Form.description:
Buscas en tu interior una parte diferente de ti mismo y la liberas, transformando tu cuerpo en otra forma. Puede polimorfarse en cualquier forma enumerada en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gfPjmG6Fe6D3MFjl] {Pest Form}, que dura 10 minutos. Todas las demás formas indómitas duran 1 minuto. Puedes agregar más formas a tu lista forma indómita con hazañas de druida; tu hazaña podría otorgarte algunas o todas las formas de un hechizo de polimorfismo determinado.

CuandoTe transformas en una forma otorgada por un hechizo, obtienes todos los efectos de la forma que elegiste de una versión del hechizo elevada al rango de forma indómita . Forma indomable te permite usar tu propio entrenamiento de cambio de forma más fácilmente que la mayoría de los hechizos polimorfos. Cuando eliges usar tu propio modificador de ataque mientras estás polimorfizado en lugar del modificador de ataque predeterminado de la forma, obtienes una bonificación de estado de +2 a tus tiradas de ataque.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.a5rWrWwuevTzs9Io] {Spell Effect: Untamed Form}

Realzado (2do) Puedes transformarte en las formas enumeradas en @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wp09USMB3GIW1qbp] {Animal Form} .

Untamed Shift.name: Cambio indómito
Untamed Shift.description:
Transformas solo una parte de tu cuerpo. Elige cualquier efecto que coincida con una hazaña de orden salvaje que tengas.

  • Forma indomable Tus manos se transforman en garras increíblemente afiladas. Las garras indómitas son un ataque desarmado, tienen rasgos de agilidad y delicadeza y causan 1d6 de daño cortante. Aún puedes sostener y usar objetos con tus manos mientras este hechizo los transforma, pero debes tener una mano libre para atacar con él.
  • Forma de insecto Tu boca se convierte en mandíbulas mortales. Las mandíbulas indomables son un ataque desarmado que causa 1d8 de daño penetrante.
  • Forma elemental Cambias tu cuerpo para que esté parcialmente compuesto de materia elemental, lo que te otorga resistencia 5 a golpes críticos y daño de precisión.
  • Forma de la planta Tus brazos se convierten en largas enredaderas, aumentando tu alcance a 10 pies (o15 pies con un arma de alcance).
  • Forma elevada Debes lanzar untamed shift usando 2 acciones para este beneficio. Te crecen alas en la espalda, ganando una velocidad de mosca de 30 pies.

    Intensificado (6º) Puede elegir hasta dos efectos de la lista. Las garras indómitas dejan heridas terribles y irregulares que también causan 2d6 de daño por sangrado persistente con cada golpe, y las mandíbulas indómitas sonenvenenado, y también inflige 2d6 de daño por veneno persistente con un golpe.

    Intensificado (10.º) Puede elegir hasta tres efectos de la lista. Las garras indómitas causan 4d6 de daño por sangrado persistente con un golpe, y las mandíbulas indómitas causan 4d6 de daño por veneno persistente con un golpe

    @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.rTVZ0zwiKeslRw6p] {Spell Effect: Untamed Shift}

Untwisting Iron Augmentation.name: Aumento de hierro desenroscado
Untwisting Iron Augmentation.description:
Tus ataques desarmados se tratan como hierro frío y plata, obtienen el rasgo de tierra y obtienen una bonificación de estado de +1 a las tiradas de daño por dado de daño.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.4ktNx3cVz5GkcGJa] {Spell Effect: Untwisting Iron Augmentation}

Intensificado (9º) Tus ataques desarmados también se tratan como adamantinos.

Untwisting Iron Buffer.name: Tampón de hierro para desenroscar
Untwisting Iron Buffer.description:
Envías corrientes de ki protector a la superficie de tu cuerpo que te protegen de cualquier daño, al menos hasta que tus enemigos las disipen. Obtienes 15 puntos de vida temporales, que duran hasta 3 rondas.

Incrementado (+1) Los puntos de vida temporales aumentan en 5.

Untwisting Iron Pillar.name: Pilar de hierro desenroscado
Untwisting Iron Pillar.description:
Invocas a la tierra y a tu ki para que te protejan de tus enemigos. Obtienes 50 puntos de vida temporales que duran mientras los pierdes o hasta que los pierdes, así como resistencia 5 a todo daño físico (excepto adamantino).

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.p8F3MVUkGmpsUDOn] {Spell Effect: Untwisting Iron Pillar}

Untwisting Iron Roots.name: Desenroscar las raíces de hierro
Untwisting Iron Roots.description:
Manipulas la tierra bajo tus pies para desequilibrar a tus enemigos, dejando trozos de roca y escombros detrás. Las criaturas dentro del alcance reciben 2d6 de daño contundente, con una salvación de Reflejos básica; en una salvación fallida, también caen @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone} . El área afectada se convierte en terreno difícil, pero puedes moverte por el terreno difícil con normalidad.

Incrementado (+1) El daño aumenta en 1d6.

Unusual Anatomy.name: Anatomía inusual
Unusual Anatomy.description:
Transformas tu carne y tus órganos en una extraña amalgama de piel reluciente, escamas ásperas, mechones de pelo y protuberancias tumorales. Esto tiene tres efectos:

  • Obtienes resistencia 10 al daño de precisión y resistencia 10 al daño adicional de los golpes críticos. Si la resistencia es mayor que el daño extra, reduce el daño extra a 0 pero no reduce el daño normal del ataque.
  • Obtienes visión en la oscuridad.
  • El ácido rezuma de su piel. Cualquier criatura que te golpee con un ataque desarmado o con un arma cuerpo a cuerpo sin alcance sufre 2d6 de daño por ácido.

Incrementado (+2) Las resistencias aumentan en 5 y el daño del ácido aumenta en 1d6.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spell-effects.Item.LMzFBnOEPzDGzHg4] {Spell Effect: Unusual Anatomy}

Updraft.name: corriente ascendente
Updraft.description:
Una poderosa ráfaga de viento surge del suelo, lanzando al objetivo al aire y enviándolo hacia abajo. La colisión causa 2d6 de daño contundente con una salvación de Reflejos básica. En caso de falla, el objetivo es derribado @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone} .

Incrementado (+1) Incrementa el daño en 2d6.

Upheaval.name: Convulsión
Upheaval.description:
El suelo en el área se estremece y se desmorona cuando enormes pilares de piedra estallan en el aire, desgarrando el terreno a su alrededor.

El DJ podría agregar efectos adicionales en ciertas áreas. Los acantilados podrían derrumbarse, provocando la caída de criaturas, o un río podría bloquearse e inundar el área circundante.

  • Escombros de piedra La zona se vuelve terreno difícil.
  • Pilares ascendentes Pilares de piedra lisa se elevan desde el número elegido de cuadrados de 10 pies sobre una superficie en el área, ascendiendo hasta 60 pies de altura. Cada pilar se detiene cuando golpea una estructura o techo, a menos que esa estructura colapse (ver más abajo). La CD para escalar o agarrar un borde de un pilar es 30. Cada criatura en un pilar después de subir debe superar una tirada de salvación de Reflejos o caerse del borde más cercano (la criatura puede elegir qué borde, si varios están igualmente cerca). Una criatura sobre un pilar quees detenido por una estructura y cae sin intentar salvarlo.
  • Colapso estructural Las estructuras y los techos podrían colapsar. El DJ tira una prueba plana para cada uno (CD 14 para una estructura robusta, CD 9 para una estructura promedio y la mayoría de las formaciones naturales, todas ajustadas hacia arriba o hacia abajo según el DJ lo considere oportuno). En general, las estructuras de mala calidad colapsan automáticamente. Un colapso causa 11d6 de daño contundente a las criaturas debajo de él; cada criatura atrapada en unEl colapso debe intentar una salvación de Reflejos para evitarlo. Si la criatura se ve obligada a intentar una salvación de Reflejos porque estaba en un pilar en ascenso, usa el mismo resultado.

Éxito crítico La criatura sufre la mitad del daño por colapso.

Éxito La criatura recibe la mitad del daño por colapso y cae @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60] {Prone} .

Fracaso La criatura sufre todo el daño por colapso y cae boca abajo.
